snippet.title: High quality finishes left nothing for the buyers of this home to do - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
27 Isles Rd, Indooroopilly.
A couple downsizing from acreage property at Brookfield were keen to snap up this stunningly renovated home close to the city. The circa 1929 property at was sold on July 21 for $1.520 million.
27 Isles Rd, Indooroopilly after the renovation.
27 Isles Rd, Indooroopilly prior to renovations.
McGrath Estate Agents - Paddington selling agent Alex Jordan said the drawcard was the level of finishes throughout the well presented home. "The styling was done by the owner, interior designer Megan Glore," Mr Jordan said. "The quality of the product was a big attraction to the two-bedroom, one-bathroom home. "The couple wanted to come closer to the city and to their family."
27 Isles Rd, Indooroopilly.
27 Isles Rd, Indooroopilly.
27 Isles Rd, Indooroopilly.
Mr Jordan said details throughout the home were completely finished in every way. "You won't be able to find another house like this," Mr Jordan said. "The house was left in a way so that the new owners had nothing to do - just walk in." The property, on a 658sq m block, is situated in an exclusive ridgetop enclave. Schools, shops and transport are nearby as is Indooroopilly Golf Course and St Lucia Golf Links.
